instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the analysis of nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used in the analysis of nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice was the back-propagation neural network (BPNN).

instruction: What metric was chosen in the analysis of nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice?
Output: The metric chosen to establish the correlation between fluorescence intensity ratios and the dose of N fertilization is the fluorescence intensity ratios themselves, specifically F685/F460, F735/F460, and F735/F685. These ratios were measured and analyzed to determine their correlation with the dose of N fertilization.

instruction: How was the back-propagation neural network (BPNN) algorithm used in the analysis of nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice using the laser-induced fluorescence (LIF) technique?
Output: The back-propagation neural network (BPNN) algorithm was used in the analysis of nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice using the laser-induced fluorescence (LIF) technique by classifying the different N fertilization levels based on the fluorescence characteristics (FLCs) measured by the LIF system. The correlation between fluorescence intensity ratios (F685/F460, F735/F460, and F735/F685) and the dose of N fertilization was established and analyzed. The BPNN algorithm was then utilized to validate that the different N fertilization levels can be classified based on these FLCs. The overall identification accuracies of 2014 and 2015 were 90% and 92.5%, respectively. This demonstrates that the BPNN algorithm, in combination with the LIF technique, can effectively classify and analyze the nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice.

instruction: How effective were the three fluorescence characteristics (FLCs) in evaluating nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice using the laser-induced fluorescence (LIF) technique combined with back-propagation neural network (BPNN)?
Output: The three fluorescence characteristics (FLCs) were found to be effective in evaluating nitrogen fertilization levels in paddy rice using the laser-induced fluorescence (LIF) technique combined with back-propagation neural network (BPNN). The correlation between fluorescence intensity ratios (F685/F460, F735/F460, and F735/F685) and the dose of N fertilization was established and analyzed. The BPNN algorithm was then used to classify the different N fertilization levels based on these FLCs. The overall identification accuracies in 2014 and 2015 were 90% and 92.5%, respectively. These results demonstrate that the three FLCs, when combined with multivariate analysis, can serve as a helpful tool in evaluating paddy rice N fertilization levels.
